attributes.action: Fair financial assistance to self employed & freelancers amid Covid-19 crisis
attributes.additional_details: HMRC have access to everyones tax returns. The payment should be fair and reasonable, could be worked on the last personal tax returns and set at 80% with £2500 cap. Fair treatment for all UK citizens.
attributes.background: As it stands the self employed, freelancers and contractors are only able to get statuatory sick pay, approx £377 a month if they have no work during the covid 19 crisis. As the backbone of many british industries and services they should have rights to further help and support during these times.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/
